item.title: Causal Inference and Panel Data
item.description:
This note summarizes key methods in causal inference using panel data, including:

  • Fixed Effects (FE) and Random Effects (RE)
  • Difference-in-Differences (DiD)
  • Instrumental Variables (IV) in panel settings
  • Assumptions for identification

📖 Inspired by: Wooldridge (2010), Angrist & Pischke (2009)

📖 See related publication

item.title: Panel Data: Advanced Concepts
item.description:
This note explores advanced topics in panel data econometrics, especially when applying causal inference logic.

Key Topics Covered:

  • 💼 Two-way Fixed Effects (TWFE): When both entity and time effects are important
  • ⚖️ Assumptions of DiD in Staggered Treatment: Parallel trends, heterogeneous treatment
  • 🔄 Event Study Designs: Pre-trend testing and dynamic treatment effects
  • 🧪 Instrumental Variables in Panel Setting: Controlling for endogeneity across time

Based on: Wooldridge (2010), Callaway & Sant’Anna (2021), Imai & Kim (2021)

item.title: Forecasting Tourism Demand with PVAR
item.description:
This research project uses Panel VAR models to predict international tourist arrivals, incorporating macro indicators:

  • Google Trends, exchange rates, GDP per capita
  • Country–quarter panel (2007–2023)
  • Evaluated using RMSE against 2024 actuals

item.title: Technology in Hotel Operations
item.description:
This undergraduate lecture introduces the role of Generative AI, automation, and digital tools in hotel operations.

Topics covered:

  • ChatGPT as a customer service agent
  • PMS and IoT integration in hotels
  • Active learning activity: AI trip planning simulation

📝 Materials available upon request.

item.title: Loss Aversion in International Tourist Spending
item.description:
This paper examines how tourists adjust their spending based on relative satisfaction, identifying patterns of loss aversion across different travel purposes.

  • Published in Tourism Economics
  • Used a pseudo-panel dataset (2007–2023)
  • Applied fixed effects with Driscoll–Kraay standard errors
